title: COMP213 - First project
text: I created a basic website using only HTML and CSS, treating it as my menu in my first semester.

title: COMP213 - Second project
text: The Protected Area Issues website utilizes list group functions, built exclusively with HTML and CSS.

title: COMP213 - Third project
text: On this website, I used the Model 3 as an example to demonstrate the product's specifications.

title: COMP213 - Fourth project
text: A static form, meeting Centennial College's requirements, is utilized to post data to the professor's API.

title: COMP213 - Final project
text: In my COMP213 final project, I made a fake Realtor, behaving as a real estate platform. Yet, this website is built using HTML and CSS.

title: COMP125 - First project
text: In my second semester, I started using JS with HTML and CSS. In one project, we created a table that loops based on two inputs: columns and rows.

title: COMP125 - Second project
text: The assignment2 involved creating a carousel gallery. Clicking a picture opens a tab with an 'add to favourites' function. Selected favourites are temporarily stored in a special gallery frame.

title: COMP125 - Third project
text: In this compact bug-counting game, bugs appear randomly in a leafy container. Each click on a bug boosts your score, with bug speed increasing per point.

title: COMP125 - Final project
text: The final assignment improved on the second one, implementing JSON within a .txt file to store data. A JavaScript script retrieves this data, populating the gallery and displaying each image's duration.
